basics.name: Julia Schmid
basics.label: Data Scientist
basics.summary: Data Scientist with 7 years of experience developing predictive models and machine learning solutions to solve complex analytical problems.

work.name: PICES - North Pacific Marine Science Organization
work.summary: Member of the BECI (Basin-scale events and coastal impacts) team, supporting the development of a digital platform serving researchers and policymakers across North Pacific nations, integrating diverse environmental datasets for risk assessment and decision support.
highlights: Architecting data infrastructure for a digital platform serving researchers and policymakers across North Pacific nations, integrating diverse environmental datasets for risk assessment and decision support.
Processing and transforming multi-GB geospatial datasets in Python, implementing ETL pipelines for pattern detection and cross-domain analysis using distributed computing workflows.
Collaborating with marine scientists and policymakers to translate complex data insights into actionable strategies for ecosystem management and climate resilience.
Supporting platform development with data and AI integration strategies designed to enable future predictive analytics.

work.name: DataAnnotation Tech
highlights: Evaluated and refined outputs from large language models across 500+ test cases, focusing on semantic accuracy, information retrieval quality, and edge-case handling for production AI systems.
Conducted systematic testing of model behavior under diverse scenarios, identifying failure patterns and contributing to model reliability improvements and prompt engineering best practices.

work.name: Angler's Atlas
work.summary: Applied machine learning, Bayesian networks, and statistical testing to large-scale digital platform and survey data to predict recreational fishing activity and analyze drivers of trip frequency and gender-based differences.
highlights: Built and deployed machine learning models (Random Forest, GBRT, SVM, Neural Networks) on spatiotemporal datasets (28,000+ samples) to forecast human activity patterns, achieving variable accuracy rates (>75%) optimized for different spatial and temporal resolutions.

Engineered automated data pipelines using Python and SQL on HPC infrastructure (Compute Canada), processing large-scale datasets and implementing reproducible statistical workflows for multi-scale analysis.

Designed and analyzed user behavior surveys (chi-square tests, Bayesian networks), extracting behavioral insights to inform product strategy and policy recommendations for recreation platform stakeholders.
Collaborated with interdisciplinary team of 6, coordinating project deliverables and communicating technical findings to non-technical audiences including policymakers and industry partners.

work.name: Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research (UFZ)
work.summary: Applied large-scale simulation modeling, machine learning, and network science to predict ecosystem dynamics under climate change and different management, identify key system drivers, and support data-driven conservation and policy decisions.
highlights: Developed and optimized process-based simulation model in C++ for grassland dynamics over 110-year climate change scenarios (RCP pathways), implementing advanced parameter calibration techniques (Dynamically Dimensioned Search, Adaptive Simulated Annealing) and contributing analytical insights to national grassland policy recommendations.

Built custom network analysis algorithms in C++ (clustering coefficient, average path length, maximum path) to analyze spatial-ecological connectivity across 20,000+ nodes in tropical forest systems, identifying small-world network properties and informing conservation strategies in three countries.

Conducted feature importance analysis using tree-based ML methods (Random Forest, Gradient Boosting) on mechanistic model outputs, performed global sensitivity analyses and cross-validation to identify key prediction drivers and evaluate model performance.

Visualized complex network structures and simulation outputs using MATLAB and R, translating technical findings into accessible formats for interdisciplinary stakeholders including ecologists, computer scientists, and policy experts.

Leipzig University of Applied Sciences, Germany

certificates.skills: Experimental Design, A/B Testing, Time Series Analysis

certificates.name: Introduction to Python

certificates.skills: Data types, Control structures, Error handling and exceptions, Functions, numpy, scipy, matplotlib

certificates.name: Introduction to Scalable Deep Learning
certificates.issuer: Jülich Supercomputing Centre (JSC) at Forschungszentrum Jülich
certificates.skills: High-performance computing (HPC) architectures, Machine learning concepts and algorithms, Distributed deep learning frameworks, Scalability and performance optimization

volunteer.summary: Thaught German to refugees from various countries in weekly sessions.
Organized and ran play and leisure activities in children's village and taught English to local children.
